p: Table 2 summarizes the most promising alkaloids derived from the African flora, published since the earlier review [ 27], while the chemical structures are shown in Figs. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10, arranged alphabetically according to their respective sub-classes (i.e. aporphines, furoquinolines, indoles, indolosesquiterpenes, Naphthylisoquinolines, protoberberines, pyridinones and others). Several of them had tested positive against CQ-sensitive and CQ-resistant strains of P. falciparum in vitro.
